text:
Asian stocks were trading mixed in early trade, after North Korea launched another missile over Japan on Friday morning in a retort to strengthened UN sanctions against Kim Jong Un’s regime.The Singapore-traded SGX Nifty, an early indicator of NSE Nifty 50 Index’s performance in India, declined 0.61 percent to 10,063 as of 6:53 a.m.Here’s a quick look at all that could influence equities on Friday.






Global Cues






U.S. stocks slipped and the dollar retreated as investors weighed renewed threats from North Korea.





#BQMarketsNow | U.S. stocks closed mixed; oil hovers near $50 per barrel mark.https://t.co/LcC2jMbYQ3 pic.twitter.com/Wx56nWim4Q— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) September 15, 2017






Asian Cues






The Topix index was up 0.1 percent as it swung between gains and losses. South Korea’s Kospi index declined 0.5 percent, while Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 Index fell 0.4 percent.Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index contract was flat.






Data To Watch






U.S. retail sales, consumer sentiment and industrial production data are due Friday.Chinese monthly lending figures are due.09/15-09/29: Second quarter balance of payments current account balance, est. -$15.40 billion, (prior -$3.43 billion)09/15-09/18: India August trade balance; estimate - $11.20 billion (prior -$11.449 billion)Exports; no estimate (prior +3.9 percent)Imports; no estimate (prior +15.4 percent)






Commodities Check






Oil was headed for a second weekly gain on forecasts for accelerating crude demand and as U.S. Gulf Coast refineries continues to recover from Hurricane Harvey.West Texas Intermediate crude slipped 0.3 percent to $49.73 a barrel after gaining 1.2 percent on Thursday and rising for a time above $50.Gold rose 0.2 percent to $1,332.43 an ounce.ICE sugar ended higher at 14.85 cents a pound; up 0.34 percent






Shanghai ExchangeSteel trades weaker for second day; down 1.13 percentAluminium down 0.15 percentZinc trades lower for a third dayCopper trades lower for third consecutive session; down 0.43 percentRubber trades lower for two consecutive sessions; down 1.33 percent

Earnings Reaction To Watch

Stocks To Watch






Xenok and GS Mace Holdings will sell 4.42 percent in Max FinancialVedanta: To buy up to 200 MW power as some units shut temporarilySpiceJet: Deposits Rs 250 crore with court to comply with ordersCoal India: On track to achieve 1 billion tonne output target, says Chairman Gopal SinghIDBI Bank: Sells 1.25 million Clearing Corp of India shares on September 13Hinduja Ventures: Acquired 7.94 lakh shares of Hinduja Leyland Finance Ltd for Rs 7.94 crore as part of the rights issueUjaas Energy: Bags EPC order from Oil India for 500 kilowatt solar projectAditya Birla Capital: Circuit filter revised to 20 percent and shifted to B groupKSK Energy: Circuit filter revised to 10 percentNesco Ex-date for stock split from Rs 10 to Rs 2 per shareInterglobe Aviation: QIP opens today in the price range of Rs1125 to Rs1175 per shareTata Elxsi: Last trading day before 1:1 bonus share ex-dateApex Frozen Foods: Last trading day in T group






Bulk Deals






Welspun Enterprises: Insight solutions sold 25 lakh shares or 1.7 percent stake at Rs 136.18 eachTeamlease Services: Manulife Asset Management (HK) bought 1.24 lakh shares or 0.7 percent stake at Rs 1615 eachGammon Infra: Promoter Gammon Power sold 1 crore shares or 1.06 percent at Rs 3.15 eachSinger Ltd: Promoter Singer (India) BV sold 1.73 lakh shares or 1.6 percent at Rs 266.1 each






IPO






ICICI Lombard General Insurance Company’s IPO open with a price band of Rs 651 - Rs 661 per share.Capacit'e Infraprojects IPO day 3: Subscribed 4.6 times on day 2.





Prataap Snacks looks to raise Rs 482 crore via IPO.https://t.co/1GlJk6mZiB pic.twitter.com/O29RprDmcz— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) September 15, 2017






Also Read: ICICI Lombard IPO: Here’s All You Need To Know






Who’s Meeting Whom?






RBL Bank met William Blair & Co on September 14Dwarikesh Sugar met Sahara MF on September 14Centrum Capital met HDFC Life Insurance on September 14Hindalco will meet FII investors like Blackrock, Manulife AMC on September 15Eicher will meet Franklin Templeton on September 15Prozone Intu Properties will speak to analysts on September 15Wonderla Holidays to meet investors and analysts on September 15Phoenix Mills will be meeting investors in HK from September 18-20KDDL will be speaking to analysts on September 19Tata Chemicals will meet Ashmore Capital on September 20






Rupee






Rupee closes Thursday’s session at 64.12 against the U.S. dollar, the lowest level since September 5.

Index Trends
















F&O Cues






Nifty September futures closed with a premium of 27.8 points from 12 pointsSep Nifty Futures open interest up 2 percent, Bank Nifty open interest up 1 percentIndia VIX closed 2.4 percent lower at 11.47September series highest call base at 10,200 (open interest at 43.5 lakh, up 6 percent)September series highest put base at 9900 (open interest at 58.7 lakh, open interest down 3 percent)Call strikes 10,150 , 10,200 see open interest addition and unwinding for 10,000Put strikes at 9950, 10000, and 10,100 see open interest addition






F&O Ban






In Ban: DHFL, India Bulls Real Estate, JP Associates, JSW Energy, Wockhardt PharmaceuticalsNo new changes to ban listOnly intraday positions can be taken in stocks under F&O ban. There will be a penalty in case of rollover.






Put-Call Ratio






Nifty PCR at 1.54 from 1.51Nifty Bank PCR at 1.33 from 1.37






Stocks Seeing High Open Interest Change






BHEL saw OI addition of 32 percent on long sideIndigo saw OI addition of 20 percent on short sideBharat Electronics saw OI addition of 12 percent on short sideVedanta saw OI addition of 10 percent on short sideIGL saw OI addition of 10 percent on long sideHCC saw OI addition of 9 percent on long sideOil India saw OI addition of 8 percent on short sideAdani Ports see OI addition of 8 percent on long sidePiramal Ent saw OI addition of 8 percent on long side

title: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On September 15
